title: Memoirs of the Life of Sir Walter Scott, Volume 6
author: Lockhart, J. G. (John Gibson)
snippet: "Sing Erceldoune, and Cowdenknowes,   Where Homes had ance commanding,   And Drygrange, wi' the milk-white ewes,  'Twixt Tweed and Leader standing.

title: Memoirs of the Life of Sir Walter Scott, Volume 6
author: Lockhart, J. G. (John Gibson)
snippet: "Sing Erceldoune, and Cowdenknowes,   Where Homes had ance commanding,   And Drygrange, wi' the milk-white ewes,  'Twixt Tweed and Leader standing.

title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.
snippet: About a mile and a half from Drygrange is the house of Cowdenknowes (Dr. Home), standing on the east bank of the Leader, at the foot of the hill of Cowdenknowes, celebrated in song for its " bonny, bonny broom."

title: Memoirs of the life of Sir Walter Scott,
author: Lockhart, J. G.
snippet: " Sing Erceldoune, and Cowdenknowes, Where Homes Lad ance commanding, And Drygrange, wi' the milk-white ewes, 'Twixt Tweed and Leaaer standing.
